I wish I would of knew this because I could of saved alot of money!!! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Our Family LOVED the Bahama House!”
Reviews.Author: amo0426
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahama House on June 16, 17 and 18. When we first got there we were given room 411. We got up to the room and opened the door and the room was GREAT, however, when we steped outside onto the balcony to have a look at our "Oceanview", all we saw was the hotel next door and heard loud noises from the hotel's air conditioning units. I immediately called the fron desk and told them very nicely that I wasn't happy with room 411 and asked if they had any other rooms available that had a better view and less noise. I talked to a really nice lady named Sandy and she said to come back down to the front desk and she would see what she could do for us. She was able to move us directly across the hall to room 410. The room was GREAT once again and this time the view from the balcony was BEAUTIFUL! We had a view of the ocean and the really nice condos called Ocean Vistas. The room itself was HUGE. It had a ful size refridgerator with a freezer, cooktop, microwave, Fiesta Ware dishes for four, silverware for four, coffee maker, lots of cupboard space, a few pots/pans. The closet and dresser area was very large. The bathroom was a bit small for four people using it, but it did have a lot of vanity space and worked fine for our family. The FREE breakfast each morning was all right. i wish that they would have had more fruit. They just had banannas everyday we were there. They also ran out of peanut butter and Frosted Flakes cereal the last morning of our stay and our 6 year old daughter was upset. She is very picky and won't eat much. We all enjoyed the happy hour each day. It was fun to talk to the other guest that were staying there. My kids are still talking about the Shirley Temples that they had. The ppol are was small, but very, very nice. The access to the beach was wonderful. They have a hose set up for you to wash off your feet after you are done at the beach, which I thought was very nice. The beach area is just wonaderful! It is so beautiful! I walked the beach a lot during out stay and felt that the Bahama House is located in a very nice area of the beach. There is an entrance ramp for cars that are wanting to drive on the beach right by the Bahama House. Cars are allowed to drive on the beach, so if you think that would bother you, then you may not want to stay there. It didn't bother us or our kids who are 6 and 11 at all. It was fun to watch people drive on the beach. You can only go 10 miles an hour. We also saw people driving golf carts, 4 wheelers, motorcycles, bikes - just about anything you can think of! The Bahama House also has FREE parking and an underground parking ramp. Yes, there is a tatoo parlor and an adult emporium across the street from the hotel. If that type of thing bothers you, then don't stay here. We were there to enjoy what's out behind the hotel - the ocean. It didn't hamper our vacation in any way. We had a GREAT time at the Bahama House and in Daytona Beach. We highly reccommend this hotel to everyone! Ann Oleson Des Moines, IA

Reviews.Title: “A Beach Oasis”
Reviews.Author: SallyRay
Reviews.Content: Although it's located along the long strip of hotels and condos, the Bahama House is a welcome refuge from the ordinary. The public area is quite comfortable. The rooms are large, well appointed, nice beds and, most of all, clean (and the towels are fluffy), Ocean views are wonderful. The staff, with the exception of a few, was extremely friendly and helpful...couldn't ask for a better front desk team. The pool area is fairly small, but quite nice, and there's ready access to the beach.This is a family-owned property, which, in my opinion, makes it a cut above the rest. Would I stay at the Bahama House again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “I see why the Bahama House is rated #1!”
Reviews.Author: nmwj66
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Bahama House after seeing that it was ranked #1 on Trip Advisor. The rate was very competitve with other hotels that were not as highly ranked. We arrived before 3:00 check in time, but we were promptly given a room. The room was very large with a full kitchen (but no oven.) There were cookies at the front desk when we arrived. Our kids could not wait for the happy hour each evening! My 12 year old felt very grown up asking for a Bahama Mama, without alcohol of course. Breakfast was only adequate, but there was plenty of it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They do not have an ice machine, but they will fill your bucket or cooler from the kitchen ice machine. This was important, since we spent our days on the beach. We will definitely stay at the Bahama House again on our trips to Daytona Beach. The only negative thing we experienced was that we were stopped by timeshare people the instant that we stepped onto the beach. Tell them NO and mean it. We attended the presentation because of the freebies that we were promised. After touring, we found that the free items we received were scams.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tanismolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahama House for a short stay on June 5th and 6th. We were pleasantly surprised by the accomodations. The rooms were very clean. There was a small kitchen and eating area. The pool is small but very nice and clean. The staff was extremely nice and very helpful. They have a nice continental breakfast that is replenished very quickly. I would suggest bringing your own beach towels since they don't supply them for the beach. If you will be there for several days, I would also suggest buying some cheap beach chairs since the rent for chairs is 20 per day (for 2 chairs and an umbrella). The area is ok. It is quite a distance from the Ocean Walk/Boardwalk and there is an adult store across the street. It also appears Daytona Beach is in the process of renovating and updating (which is greatly needed). The Bahama House was the best value for the money. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & Relaxing stay at the Bahama House”
Reviews.Author: scoobydew007
Reviews.Content: The Bahama House is an excellent place to stay if you are planning to visit Daytona Beach. The room was clean and the staff was extremely helpful. When we checked-in and went to our room, a sign was posted on the door which stated do not enter. The front desk provided us with another room and even gave us an upgrade to ocean front. The breakfast was well stocked and the happy hour was good. The parking underground was nice to keep the car cool and the parking is free not like other hotels in Daytona Beach. The hotel is located in the quite section of Daytona Beach which was great for us with kids. Overall, the hotel is a great place to stay with reasonable rates and friendly staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Bahama House was terrific!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: neen917
Reviews.Content: I originally booked us at a "resort and spa" in Daytona Beach, but after reading the reviews of it on here, changed to Bahama House...and boy I'm glad I did. This place was GREAT!!! Hotel staff was friendly, not only to us but each other. Check-in and out was a breeze. Hotel room was great!! View was great!! Pool was great!! (Love Wink...if you stay here you'll find out who he is) The cookies at the front desk are some of the best my family has ever had. Breakfast was sufficient..no bacon, eggs and sausage but will deffinately get you through the day. We loved happy hour...especially my son whose fav drink was a Shirley Temple. My fav happy hour was at the end of the week with a sweet sweet magician who was really good. One of the reviews I read said that they're complaint was no places to eat around the hotel and they had to drive everywhere. Well, that is true but I didn't mind the 2 mile drive to eat somewhere. Besides, if you stay in a hotel near the boardwalk, it seems like it would be a little noisier and more for the party scene. My family and I will deffinately stay here again if we go back to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “The Bahama House Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum0313
Reviews.Content: After looking through the hotels on Trip Advisor I decided to choose the Bahama House because at the time it was number 1. I think I made a great choice. We stayed for two nights on our way home from Disney and it was great. Everything was really clean and the staff was very friendly. The free drinks were awesome and we made sure to attend the cocktail hour both nights! If I am ever back in Daytona I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: xmush1620x
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and his band played at one of the local bars in Daytona Beach, so we booked the closest hotel: Boardwalk Inn. However, the night before we left, I stumbled across this website and realized it was #67 out of #113!!! Gross! Long story really short, we booked the Bahama House for EXACTLY the same price, yet it was rated number ONE for Daytona Beach. We actually saved $20, because there was no charge for parking. The staff was extremely helpfull and nice. Breakfast was nothing spectacular, but MUCH cleaner than any other breakfast joints nearby. The hotel is right next to the ramp on the beach, which was nice and to my surpirse, not too busy either. My only complaint was parking. Because the band was playing at a local bar, we didn't get to the hotel until 3AM both nights, only to find NOT one parking spot. The security guard was a little off, but allowed us to park under the loading/unloading area each night.

Reviews.Title: “Tennis Weekend”
Reviews.Author: deepbluefau
Reviews.Content: May 15-18, 2008 My tennis team stayed at the Bahama House while participating in a tennis tournament in Daytona. We found the staff at the Bahama House most accommodating. The rooms were large, clean and comfortiable. Good access to the ocean and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great...”
Reviews.Author: Unladylike
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews of this hotel, we booked a stay for 3 nights on our way home from the Orlando area. There is an underground parking lot that is pretty easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. We arrived & the front desk area was very clean & the employee who checked us in was very helpful. She gave us a little goody bag of samples & sent us on our way. As we walked into our room, immediately I noticed a strong smell of bleach. Good to know that everything is clean, but yuck. We took our shoes off & as I stepped onto the carpet It felt very damp. I don't know if that was from them cleaning it or from the moisture from the ocean, but it felt so gross. It was like that the entire time we were there. We all chose to wear flip flops in the room so that we wouldnt have to feel it. We got a room with a kitchen, and the kitchen was very clean. There was 1 pot, 1 pan, and some silverware. The bathroom was kind of outdated & gross honestly. The grout on the shower was very dirty & old looking and I was totally disgusted when I found hairs in the bathtub. The bathroom also had a strong smell of mildew. The free breakfast consisted of pastries and little bowls of cereal. The milk was in this huge container that looked like it was meant for coffee & we could see these clumps of white stuff floating in it. I totally lost my appetite at that point & we went elsewhere for food. I don't consider myself a picky person, but this place just kinda disgusted me. I definitely wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Bahama House Stay”
Reviews.Author: Loucee
Reviews.Content: My husband had been out of state for a month, so wanted to treat him to a relaxing mini-break close to home. After reading several positive reviews, decided to book at Bahama House. I booked a "standard" room, so was very surprised and pleased to find, when we checked in this past Thursday, that we had been "upgraded" without charge, to a large efficiency room directly facing the ocean. Staff was very friendly and welcoming, check in was a breeze. We were very pleased with the room. Very spacious, clean, and well appointed. When I originally made the reservation I knew we would be having lunch and dinner "out"...but anyone booking an efficiency here, planning to do simple meals "in", would be very satisfied I am sure. The kitchen area was well appointed with a full size refridgerator, microwave, small cook-top style range, coffee pot, and and ample supply of dishes, cookware, etc. The pool area was exceptionally clean, and there was an ample supply of pool chairs and towels. The pool itself was a decent size, and I think it had to have been heated? The water temperature was very comfortable. The hot tub wasn't that great, only two jets were functioning. We enjoyed and appreciated the fresh cookies at the front desk, and the free "happy hour" drinks! The Continental breakfast was ample for our needs, and served in an attractive dining area. The only negative part of our stay was the fact that we had VERY noisy people in the room next door. We were awake for hours most of the first night of our stay, listening to loud voices, banging doors, people raising hell out on the balcony, etc etc. Finally around 1AM we called the front desk to complain. We were told "it would be taken care of".....Well, the noise etc continued for a few more hours. Basically, our first night at Bahama House was ruined. The next morning at breakfast we discovered quite a few other people talking about the noise that this one room was making all night, there on the 4th floor. An employee overheard us, and stated that "if that had happened on a WEEKEND the noisy/drunk people would have been kicked right out". Personally, I don't see why noisy/drunk people should be tolerated on WEEKDAYS!! It is unfortunate that this hotel does not have more of a strict policy in regard to guests who party/make noise and disturb other customers staying there. So that is my only complaint about "Bahama House". You will have a great stay there I am sure, providing there aren't any "rowdy" guests on your floor!

Reviews.Title: “Busy Location”
Reviews.Author: pcorlandomom
Reviews.Content: I had booked my room online and I thought this property was on the Southern quieter end of Daytona. This property is right across the street from an Adult Store and a Tattoo Parlor. It is also right on the corner of a beach ramp. There was so much traffic on the beach at this corner that with 4 children, 2 of which are under the age of 7, it was very difficult to make it to the water. I cannot believe that so many people have been so happy with this property with its horrible location for families with kids. Also, we checked in very late and the office staff was very slow. They couldn't find our paperwork at first and then when they finally did they were very rude to us. This is the first time I have ever had a problem with a late check-in when I go to Daytona or that the desk staff has been rude to me. We had also requested a crib when we made the reservation and I had been assured it would be there when we arrived. I double checked with the rude desk clerk to see if it was in the room and he said it was. When we got up to the room it was no where to be found. I called the office and told them and they told me I had to wait till the morning. We had brought my daughter's 11 month old baby with us and now we were going to have to have her sleep in the bed with us because they couldn't get us one when I hade requested it several times to make sure it wasn't over looked. Positives: The room was clean, and they had a nice outdoor pool area, but that is all that they really had to offer. I live in Orlando, so my husband and I go to Daytona frequently just to get away from things, but I will never be going back to the Bahama House.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: Harderbunch5
Reviews.Content: Excellent here, we stayed here from the E tour and Travel deal. One of the best hotels on our trip. Nice location nice pool and hot tub. There happy hour at the bar was outstanding " FREE DRINKS". NIce comp breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ~ Super Value”
Reviews.Author: Zarings3
Reviews.Content: What a great deal for an excellent property! We visited the Bahama House the end of March. They upgraded our room on arrival to a full ocean view. Each room has a large balcony which is angled so you are not just staring at your neighbors. The view is straight out, over the small pool and to the beach. We loved it! The room was spotless and quite roomy. It has a nice kitchen area and a full size fridge which was great! They even provide real dishes, not paper or plastic! We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping was great, the desk staff was very friendly and the lady pouring drinks at the cocktail hour was very social and nice. We would definately return to stay longer and would recommend them to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rjyoung
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bahama House for three nights beginning March 26th. We arrived late at night (midnight) and check in was a breeze! We had our little guy with us, so at the time of check in I requested a crib and it was up in the room before I even had the car unpacked! We also received a nice little welcome package from the hotel consisting of a razor, lemonade packets, deodorant and a few other little things, it was a nice touch! Our room was just as described in other reviews, large with a kitchenette, two queens (which were comfortable) and a great view of the beach and ocean, we werent oceanfront but rather oceanview off to the side, which was still a great view. We really enjoyed the continental breakfast and the happy hour drinks. The pool was great! not too hot, not too cold, we spent a lot of time on the beach and the hotel even had beach toys and sand pails and such that we could use for the kids! All in all, it we had a great time at the Bahama House, and would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahama House!”
Reviews.Author: Stone2122
Reviews.Content: The Bahama House was a pleasant surprise. Upon entering our room, my first impression was the clean, fresh smell of the room! Our room was a nice size and included a full frig, 2 burner flat-top stove, microwave, and a small sink. We had 2 queen beds with wonderful linen and lots of pillows. One bed was too close to the closet and was inconvenient. Our room was "ocean view" but we had a wonderful view of the beach from the north. (We were in 208). The balcony was larger than normal with room for several chairs. The bathroom needed more counter space, but was nice and clean. You have to go to the first floor to get ice or they will bring a bucket to your room. the freezer had an automatic icemaker, but ours had been turned off and it took a while to fill up. VERY small, 4 cup cofffee maker in the room. The hotel offers a nice continental breakfast, but you had better be there before 9:30 or it is gone! They also offer a complimentary Happy Hour each afternoon. The pool area was nice, but small. Pool chairs were at a premium, even if you went down at 8am. There were more chairs down the lower level facing the ocean, but they were taken before 9am. Bring your own chair or rent one if you are a late riser!!! The hotel offers pool towels as you leave the back door. Wireless internet access was available in the lobby, but they were in the process of making the rooms wireless while we were there last week. Maid service was excellent and most have been at the hotel for years. Travelers visit year after year and some for weeks at a time! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: CuyunaCuyuna
Reviews.Content: Everything was better than we anticipated. Check in was friendly and quick. Our room was superb. Very clean. Towels were large and soft. Pillows were good. We asked for more pillows and extra towels and received them quickly and promptly with no problems. Kitchen was great. Full size fridge was wonderful. Breakfast and Happy Hour were a really nice extra. (Being on vacation, we only wished breakfast was a little later... After being on the beach or by the pool each day, we never quite got to dinner until 7:30 or 8:00 and then home at the earliest 10 ish, then either we played a game, watched TV or read until close to midnight. We had a teenage boy and a college daughter who felt 9:30 was a little too early.... I don't really blame them... beach vacations run at a slower pace even for me. 8:30 - 10:30 would have been our preference, but we are only one group of guests.) A problem we encountered was we were told that "wi-fi" or wireless internet would be available free of charge. Our son has an iPod touch and could not log onto the internet after more than a couple tries. We were pretty sure it wasn't a problem with the iPod because we have wireless internet at home and it works fine. It wasn't a big deal, we're just posting this to notify the employees at the Bahama House of this problem. Also, we didn't know about or remember the cookies available until our last day. :( Our only other "problem" was the two "fire" alarm" evacuations we had to leave the building for at 2:30 a.m. and 5::00 a.m. We know there was nothing management could have done to prevent these. It just happened to be our last night... we had to be at the airport at 8 a.m. and had stayed up late the night before (being our last night). In fact, I really felt somewhat protected and safe... the alarm system worked perfect. It was able to wake us up and get us out quickly. I have always wondered how you would evacuate a hotel in the middle of the night and wondered how reliable a system could be. So in a way, I could thank you...! :) And finally, what we liked the very best, was the view... oh my gosh! It was like HEAVEN ON EARTH! We felt we were practically on top of the water! We were in awe each and every day. The view was incredible! Our curtains only closed when it was dark. We left the door open most of the time because we all loved the listening to the ocean. Thank you for being part of a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShariTn
Reviews.Content: My family of four had only planned on staying a couple of nights as a stopoff on the way to Cocoa Beach. When we walked out on the balcony facing the ocean and then looked around our room, I immediately booked one more night. The motel was very clean and pleasant with easy access to the beach. The beds were really comfortable, but bring your own pillow--their pillows had lumps like the feathers had clumped together after cleaning. I do agree with the traveler who said that there was not much information in the room about the motel. That might be something the motel could work on. The staff seemed pleasant. Altogether, we were very pleased and my children are begging to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mildly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: michiganmand
Reviews.Content: We booked our room over the internet, sight unseen, but I had thought we were getting a room facing the ocean. Their website has confusing room descriptions and no really good pictures of the outside of the hotel itself, nor of the view you get from your room. So upon checking in, we discovered our room faced the street, with the fumes and noise that accompanied the tail-end of bike week. Argued with the desk clerk afterwards, but they wouldn't take any responsibility (the website is run by a third party, they said), so we paid $25 a night to upgrade to oceanfront. Not happy there. Then I began compiling a list of minor complaints, which surprised me since so many previous guests had raved about this place. Not me here. In fact, I began to wonder about the integrity of the TripAdvisor reviews I read. The high speed internet is only wireless in the lobby area. For internet access in your room you have to deposit $35 to receive a cable, which probably retails for $10 or less, then hook it up in your room. The cable is too short to use your computer anywhere but on the bed. I never could get it to work anyhow and since trying my computer hasn't been working right. This could have been my fault but another complaint I had was with the dearth of information that came with our room. Though we received a packet of info and sundries when we checked in, there was precious little information on the high speed internet, pool hours, TV offerings, guest services, etc. A book in the room provided some information and advertising, but was a bit lacking as well. Based on a promise of free delivery, we ordered pizza from an advertiser in the book and was charged $2 for delivery. As others have noted, there are few shops or restaurants within close walking distance, unless you count the adult emporium and tattoo parlor directly across the street. The free newspaper is not the usual USA Today, but the smaller Daytona daily, which did give us the TV listings, helpful since we couldn't learn what was on HBO otherwise. We also read of the search for a serial killer in Daytona. Wonderful. Finally, missing from our room was a bottle opener that we thought would have been provided with a full kitchen, and a "Do Not Disturb" tag. We snagged a replacement tag from housekeeping when they came by. On the plus side, the hotel is clean and well maintained, the staff is helpful and friendly, and the views--even those facing the street--are captivating. The complimentary happy hour is popular and understandably so with unlimited drinks. Though I was expecting the type of punch bowl setting you might get at an inexpensive wedding reception, they actually have a bartender with a modest but interesting drink selection. The bahama mama is a tasty and potent potable. The complimentary chocolate chip cookies at the front desk are fresh and absolutely delicious also. For those wanting a bit more on the snack side, in back of the hotel is a beach concession area so you can order a hot dog or a funnel cake. You can rent a golf cart near there too. If you want to drive the beach in your own car, a ramp from the street right next to the hotel conventiently allows you to do so. I should note that I've never been too fond of busy beachfront resort destinations. My experiences at Myrtle Beach and Virginia Beach helped to convince me that these types of places are the definition of tourist traps. Still, I was expecting more from the Bahama House because of its Number One listing on TripAdvisor for Daytona Beach. A little clarity in advertising would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jjk474
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was outstanding. Hotel Staff - Very friendly and helpful Hotel - Clean and in new condition Pool - Clean Pool area -chairs and tables in new condition Rooms - could not find one thing to complain about This hotel meets all the requirements for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Mia1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahama House for two nights with my mum and thought it was quite good. The view was amazing! The beds were good and the kitchenette with a fridge was great to make coffee and keep milk in! The breakfast downstairs was also nice. The only thing I would say, though, is that the surrounding area isn’t that pleasant. We arrived quite late and were hungry. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant and then we had to get in the car to drive somewhere and the nearest place just closed in front of us at 9pm on the dot! The waiter did tell us about other restaurants but they were miles away. Eating after 9pm isn’t late, is it? If I had to return to Daytona Beach I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BeachRydr
Reviews.Content: The Bahama House is nice. We stayed there in December of 2007 when the Oceanafront at Daytona was pretty much dead. Needless to say there were many good deals for Oceanafront rooms advertised on the hotel signs. The problem is finding a hotel that is actually clean and in good repair. I checked with Bahama House first but thought we could do a little better on price. After stopping at several more hotels and looking at rooms, we were back. This hotel has an awesome lobby, breakfast area, and pool / hot tub outdoor area. I do think they need better tables in the breakfast area however. Short and unstable. The continental breakfast offered was typical but nice. The pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. Pool was heated for December and the hot tub was a good temperature. The room we had was spacious, in good repair, and clean. Full kitchen. You automatically received a goodie bag of various sundries on check in. Underground, sheltered parking was available. That was nice as you are right on the ocean. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Delicious self serve cookies were available at the desk. On checkout, we were even provided a few bottles of their own label water. Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Elysed
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Daytona Beach without a hotel reservation just before the holidays. We drove up and down S. Atlantic and looked at about 4 different hotels before finding the Bahama House. As soon as we walked in we felt like we'd found a great place to stay. The staff at the front desk was beyond accommodating and friendly. We looked at a room, and checked in immediately. We were on the 5th floor in a beautiful corner room. It was very clean, cheerful and had great water pressure in the shower. Our room was cleaned daily (except the dishes), and the staff was very helpful when we asked for coffee and ice. We felt very fortunate to have found the Bahama House, especially after looking at a number of the other hotels along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Bahama House”
Reviews.Author: Illusive333
Reviews.Content: The wife & I stayed Dec 13th & 14th. Everything was as advertised, but the heated pool wasn't warm enough to swim in and the hot tub ONLY has two jets working <= from talking to the maintenance man, this has been and continues to be a problem with NO scheduled resolvement. We moved to the Sun Viking with an indoor pool and a fully functioning hottub. We'll be "trying" the D'Beach Islander Hotel in March 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tallie13
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean and comforable. Staff were friendly. They do have some larger rooms so if you are travelling with teenagers, ask about these rooms. The only drawback we found was that we had to drive to find a "nice" evening meal. Kitchenette was ideal for making light meals. This would be our choice for staying in Daytona Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Clean Hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: melliewallace
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay here and were very pleased with the Bahama House. The hotel is very clean and well cared for. Housekeeping did a nice job of servicing us with fresh towels when needed. They also made the beds and stacked all of our daughters' stuffed animals at the top of her bed. She loved this! The rooms are big and spacious and it looks as though every room as a nice view of the ocean. Our room was not oceanfront, (in other words, no view of pool...) but we could still see the ocean. The people here are so nice and really attend to your every need. The breakfast is okay, just a standard hotel breakfast and we didn't go to the "cocktail" hour. Things to know before you go: 1.) The rooms do not have a "FULL" kitchen as the website advertises. (Well, some might, but ours did not...) It has a kitchenette...which is 1 sink, a micro, a full size frig, and a two burner stove. There is no oven, no dishwasher, and very minimal cooking utensils. It was fine for us, b/c we only stayed for a couple of nights, but if you are used to staying for long periods in a condo or similiar surroundings, as we are, this might not be the best situation for you. 2.) There is a laundry facitlity on the 2nd floor. We didn't use it, so I can't comment on it. 3.) The pool area is nice (towels are provided without hassle) and the pool was always sparkling clean! It was heated at night to a nice warm temp., which our daughter loved! We didn't use the hot tub, so again no comment...It looked nice. Only two negatives, no kiddie pool and no ramp to the beach. There are two sets of stairs, but no ramp for wheelchairs, etc. If you are taking a stroller to the beach, it can prove very difficult. All in all this is a nice clean place with a very friendly atmosphere! I would stay here again if I was only planning to stay for a couple of nights. If I was planning to stay for longer than 4-5 nights, I probably would not, just because I am used to staying in condos and like the convenience of in "room" laundry facilities and a completely full kitchen. However; this is no fault of the hotel. For a hotel, it is a good value and I would recommend it to friends. :) Just a note: We travel to Florida quite frequently, but it has been a while since we have visited Daytona. (Spent lots of time in the area as children/teenagers). Daytona is still a somewhat seedy place, but it is undergoing a great renovation. We saw lots of positive changes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, noisy refrigerator and wall air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: Nifferchic
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean with nice amenities such as a free coctail hour and continental breakfast. The room was nice and clean with a great view of the ocean from the attached balcony. The air conditioner (wall unit) ran loud all night with the fan kicking on and off. I rather stay in a room with it's own thermostat and vents vs. a window unit. The refrigerator in the room was working fine until 2:00 am when it starting making an obnoxious ear piercing noise. I told the front desk when I checked out and she didn't seem to care and said she would send a maintenance person to check on it. She handed me a bottle of water and sent me on my way. Also, don't park outside in the south lot, the water spriklers will come on and make a mess of your car. If I was informed that there was an underground parking lot when I checked in, I would have taken advantage of it! There isn't a lot of nice hotels anymore in Daytona, so I would say this is a nice place to stay for your money.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shrubba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahama House for a week on August 19th 2007. We arrived to a very clean and beautiful lobby area. One thing that did scare my travelling partners was a very large grasshopper in the parking lot! I go to Florida every year but in September and I have never seen these things before! Must be the season - they are huge but they don't bother anyone and I had fun watching them! Anyway, the lobby was very nice and check in was a breeze. The elevators are a little slow when it's busy but getting to our room was easy. We had a partial ocean view - our balacony was on the side of the building. It was still a great view of the ocean and of the moon on the water. The room itself was very nice. Very clean and comfortable. We had a small kitchen with microwave. They provided all silverware, plates, etc. They also provided dishwashing soap which was nice. At 5:30pm there is a happy hour - free drinks and popcorn. They also had an elderly gentleman there doing magic tricks. He was alot of fun and very good. In the morning they provided a small breakfast - coffee, juice, cereal, danish, and some other items. Very good - and fresh! After breakfast, the front desk has fresh cookies for free! They were so YUMMY!! Our whole week was very enjoyable and I would recommened this hotel to anyone. The staff are great and always had a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: maddmurphy
Reviews.Content: We only spent 2 nights in this place but it was the best 2 nights we ever spent in ANY hotel ANYWHERE!! Great big spacious room with a kitchen, great balcony, oceanfront view, great pool and spa! Besides the amenities, the staff was great! Very friendly, went out of their way & the welcome was fantastic!! Complimentary happy hour and continental breakfast! Close to downtown shops. Great experience there.... will only go back to Daytona if we can stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 30yoldcanadian
Reviews.Content: When my fiancee and I booked an oceanfront efficiency for an extended stay in July, I was really hoping that it would be just as nice as the smaller Daytona hotels used to be when I was a kid. It was my fiancee's first time visiting the ocean, and I wanted it to be perfect. Well, it wasnt exactly like the hotels used to be before all the condos started popping up... it was better! Our entire experience was wonderful. We arrived to check-in during happy hour, and the entire lobby area was packed with people moving in and out of the breakfast area. It was a bit chaotic, but the desk staff were completely in control, they were ready for us and soon we had been whisked off to our quiet room on the second floor. I highly recommend getting a second-floor room if you can. It was perfect because it had a great view of the ocean framed by palm trees, but it was still easy to walk down the steps to the lobby and not have to wait for an elevator. Access to the property is easy, and the underground parking is a big plus, especially in the hot July weather. We always managed to score a parking spot next to the elevators. One night we returned quite late from a day-trip and the garage had been shut down for the night. All we had to do was let the security guard know that we had come in, and he quickly radioed down for an attendent to open the doors. The room was great. I was suprised to find that the kitchen did not include an oven, but it had an oversized microwave, so we soon adapted. There were plenty of cooking utensils and dishes, and so I did not have to use any of the tools in my "kitchen kit" that I usually bring when I am staying in efficiency units. The beds were clean and the bathroom was well-maintained. I would have liked to see a clothes line for hanging wet bathing-suites. The pool area was well-maintained, and although the hotel seemed pretty full when we were there, the pool was never over-crowded. There were always lots of pool towels available, and plenty of chairs. It was a great first-experience for my fiancee, and a wonderful trip for me. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel......but.....”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights with a group traveling to Daytona for USTA Tennis. In all we had about 5 rooms. As others have said, the place is nice, loved the full size refrig and balcony, and the happy hour was a nice touch. Quiet location. About 2 1/4 mile hike to the boardwalk. Only one problem...BED BUGS.. Better than half our group complained of bites and welts. A shame because visably the place looks nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great again...”
Reviews.Author: nanaee
Reviews.Content: Great as always...keep up the good work guys If you find the guy that stole my sandals just tell him to keep them ...they were old.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Bahamas House!”
Reviews.Author: LoriDM
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms. Complimentary happy hour and continental breakfast. Pleasant staff. Well kept grounds and pool/spa deck (constant supply of pool towels too!). Excellent vista from our oceanview room on the north side of the hotel, with a nice size furnished balcony. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy beachside retreat!”
Reviews.Author: sashablum
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night at the beginning of July. The rooms were very large and incredibly clean. It was also incredibly convenient to have a kitchenette in our room (full size fridge, cooktop, microwave) especially since we were travelling with young children. Our balcony had a great view of the beach....just steps from the hotel. The pool area was clean and the pool itself was the perfect temperature. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour as well as cookies were nice touches. Overall the hotel was very clean and in an incredible location right on the beach! I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valster99
Reviews.Content: We Recommend this Hotel. We had never been to Daytona and really had no idea where to stay. We heard all the horror stories of hotels and bugs and I definetly did not want to experience that. After checking most of the Review sites, The Bahama House had all positive reviews, so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. We stayed for 6 nights from June 6-13/07 and The Bahama House was bug free. It was a great place to stay, very clean, very friendly and of course the little extras make such a difference. We loved the Happy Hour each day at 5:30, the continental breakfast hit the spot and the newspaper and cookies each day was a nice treat. The next time we visit, this is where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dschuler2
Reviews.Content: Had a hard time deciding on a hotel at the beach. Glad I chose this one, it's by far the cleanest hotel around Daytona and it's right at the beach. Had an oceanfront room on the 5th floor. Would recommend to everyone going to the beach. Free popcorn in the evening I think around 5:30. Not much to eat around the hotel. There was a pizza hut down the street and a few miniature golf places just down the street was nice. Right across the street it was kind of rundown. Lots of activities and food about 2 miles inland. Hotel has good parking and service. Quiet relaxing hotel worth the $$$. There is driving on the beach right outside the hotel which I didn't like being with kids and the pollution and traffic and all ,but it wasn't that bad. Does make me miss the hawaiian beaches though.

Reviews.Title: “Bahama House is Great!!”
Reviews.Author: fredaWashington_Pa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Daytona Beach and a 4 night stay at the Bahama House. What a treat! I've stayed at other hotels in the area, booked on-line and ended up very disappointed, to say the least. This hotel is clean, well maintained and has very friendly staff to boot. My husband and I enjoyed the happy hour as did my teen-age daughter and her friend (virgin Bahama Mamas!!). The view from our balcony was amazing and each morning we woke to a delivered newspaper and a continental breakfast. I loved loved loved the deck facing the beach from the hotel. No sand to deal with but still enjoyed the roar of the ocean while watching the girls in the water, doesn't get much better than this. Thank you, Bahama House, see you next time we're in Daytona. Teri Close

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: volunteerlilfe85
Reviews.Content: This being my first time staying in a Daytona Beach area hotel, I wasn't sure quite what to expect. The Bahama House was incredible! The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were immaculate, the was pool spotless, the (complimentary) continetal breakfast and happy hour were fantastic, and the ocean views were breathtaking. I had no problems at all during my stay -- I've already booked a room for a summer vacation later on this year! My room was spacious and very, very clean. Fresh towels were brought up promptly at my request, and the front desk staff was very helpfull in helping me choose where to dine locally. Oh!! The lobby, which is cooly decorated in a breezy available for guests to enjoy. I was able to have a picnic lunch in the "Grand Bahama Room", which has beautiful views of the beach. I would reccommend the Bahama House to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this property!”
Reviews.Author: JLDeal
Reviews.Content: My closest friend and I stayed at the Bahama House for a girls weekend in April (2007). I had planned this much need weekend for just the two of us for about three months. She’s a new mother and I’m a seasoned one, who both needed a break. We had such a fantastic time. The room was incredible. We stayed in one of the ocean view efficiencies on the South side of the building. We loved it! The complimentary weekend happy hour was the perfect start to our evenings. The staff was absolutely wonderful and the accommodations were fantastic. Jo Lynn Deal

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good view, good sevice!”
Reviews.Author: beezlebub
Reviews.Content: For what you are paying, it really can't be beat. Especially in Daytona. I've seen people complain about the breakfast and happy hour... but when you're paying only $135 per night, you can afford to eat elsewhere! The rooms are clean and orderly, as well as the lobby, which is ammaculate. The place is family owned and operated, which is a big plus for us. They also have another hotel, The Aku Tiki, which is equally nice. Overall good value, and a safe bet during the races.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahama House”
Reviews.Author: sassymi2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bahama House for 2 days in early November following a cruise out of Port Canaveral. What a wonderful experience. Had a 10th floor oceanview room with a balcony which had a beautiful view of the ocean. Room was large and clean. had a full kitchen, sofa, dining table, desk table as well as a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Hotel lobby and grounds were spectacular and clean. Workers seemed like one big happy family who met your every need and made you feel at home. The continental breakfast was one of the best we have ever seen and the nightly cocktail party was a great experience. they make a great Bahama Mama! The hotel has undeground parking and a beautiful pool area--well landscaped with plenty of lounge chairs as well as tables and chairs. Great location with wireless internet in the lobby. Huge lcd tv in the lobby. Beautiful view of the ocean from the wonderfully decorated dining area. One of the best beach hotels we have stayed at in Florida! Approximately 12 years old but seems brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Pretty Nice for Daytona Beach...”
Reviews.Author: James98109
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, I guess I was expecting a little more bang for my buck. The hotel is fairly run-of-the-mill, but may be one of the nicer joints in Daytona Beach, which is not saying much. Our room felt marginal as far as cleanliness goes, and the bathroom was pretty-well aged. The fridge and microwave were a nice touch, though. The beach-side pool and hot tub were enjoyable. The hotel offers a number of activities during the week, which makes it feel a little more like a retirement home. Not unreasonable as we were easily the youngest people there, and I'm in my mid-thirties! Skip Daytona Beach altogether and stay in Orlando, but if you have to stay, I might recommend springing for a room a the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahama House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Bahama House based on the TripAdvisor reviews and rating. I'm glad we did. The room was wonderful - clean and fresh, with a lovely balcony where we sat and watched the sunrise and listened to the sounds of the ocean. The staff was unobtrusive yet friendly, courteous, and attentive - and the complimentary Happy Hour was an unexpected, very pleasant surprise! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Defense of The Bahama House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahama House a few years ago, and are considering returning this winter. The hotel location was perfect for our young family, lots to see down at the New Smyrna beach end, and lots of restaurants North. The previous review said it was not a "great place to stay"...I strongly disagree. It is simple comfort, not a five star, but excellent service from tha staff, and enough little perks, like the homemade cookies at the front desk, the FREE cocktail hour and continental breakfast, to make it a pleasant experience...If you don't like the heat, don't visit FLORIDA! We loved The Bahama House, and we hope to see you there in April.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place!”
Reviews.Author: CTYankey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahama House for three nights. I was shocked that it was rated #1 on this forum. It is true that the onsite parking was convenient. The staff was pleasant and when we had a problem with the ice machine in our refrigerator it was fixed immediately. The hotel was just not high quality in any way. The rooms were large but the towels were thin and the paper products (toilet paper, etc.) were really cheap. The happy hour was okay but it was hot with no A/C in the lobby. They had pretzels and popcorn as snacks all three nights. The breakfast was a continental breakfast which was not expanded at all. It appeared that they got boxes of mini donuts or other small breakfast items and put them out. Many places these days make more of an attempt to have some interesting items. No Splenda or Equal, only Sweet N' Low--ick. The area was shabby and not what we were hoping for. We won't be returning.

HotelInfo.Name: Bahama House
HotelInfo.Address: 2001 South Atlantic Ave., Daytona Beach, FL 32118
